relation: Great for these types of students
This school is great for someone who just wants to start off small and cant handle a big college.
Attending this school is alittle to expensive but then again it is a privately funded junior school so prices will always go up.
Go to the play room or play volleyball at the park but its a small town. Not much to do.
The food isnt all that. The best place to eat is at the Cove because it actually has good food but they never change their food choices on the menu.
Wheeler hall is the best dorm to live in because it has top security and the best rooms but its extremly expensive. $2500 per semester for a junior college is ridiculous.
If you are attending this college...only come for the 2 years then transfer and make sure that you are able to pay your tution and any extra.

I rate Blinn College-Brenham Campus an 6 from a scale 1 to 10. They have qualified teachers but the school is constantly asking for extra money and it has to much campus police. They also show signs of discrimination.

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot It's definately a big change from high school. Some teachers are set in their ways and have their own methods, so you just have to go with the flow. Classes aren't that bad, even if you slacked in high school. Just apply yourself and you should do fine. Login to rate or flag the reviews Ariel from College Station, TX 01/11/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 5 out of 6 people found this review useful. 3 of 87 Categories Comments Great for these types of students If you love a conservative and calm atmosphere, Blinn is a great place to go. Also, students who want to attend Texas A&M University usually attend Blinn for one or two years. Blinn has the highest transfer rate to A&M. In fact, many of the professors at Blinn also teach courses at the A&M campus. It is a cheaper path to get some of the prerequisite courses out of the way before one is to pay the high tuition of Texas A&M
